title: Monthly Treeverse Update #30
content:
An update on Treeverse. A look at our development and art team progress. We will be posting monthly for you to follow along the development of Treeverse, so make sure you subscribe!

Oh boy is it a busy next few months for us. We are pushing out our Q2 quota content, and behind on a few things such as SFX and VFX. For the next build when we announce it (you won’t know until we have some bit of confidence but we do have an internal deadline) will have missing stuff // uncomplete work — but still excited to get it out for you!

Last reminder that we have our Plushie Package and Care Package up for sale. These won’t be in the store much longer, and we most likely won’t have any physical items dropping anytime before the official launch of the game.

Art Update

Engineering And Design

by Aizea

We've been hard at work improving the codebase and setting the foundations for bigger and better features in the game. We onboarded a very talented developer recently after trying to hire for a long period of time, and our existing developers are also getting significantly better at writing better code.

Designers are finally able to start using some of the newer tools we've created.

Improvements

We worked on making various improvements in the codebase. Some are more technical in nature such as the way we do our UI, others are re-implementations of old systems, just using better code and patterns to achieve the same thing we had before, with the added benefit of extensibility and simpler systems.

  • UI codebase

  • Items

  • Quest

  • Assembly definitions

  • Reward System

    • We realised that anything that needs to give something to a player can all be funnelled through this system.

  • Ghost Networking Split

  • Combat refactor

    • After implementing the stats system, we had the opportunity to reimplement our combat system. This is ongoing.

  • Baking Process

    • Rework how sub scenes are queued for baking to make it faster.

New Features

We added some new systems that are completely novel, and others that had to be re-implemented after our item refactors.

  • Navmesh

  • Stats system

  • Buff system

  • Shopping

  • Gathering

  • Animations

  • Google Sheets localisation tool

Bug Fixes

Bugs are inevitable. We just need to squash them as we we go.

  • Abilities

  • Bootstrap bug

  • memory leaks

  • Build issues

Started / Continue

These

  • Saving System with migration support

  • Trading System

  • Login

  • CICD

    • Kubernetes setup and allowing our game servers to use domain names for connection purposes.

Going Forward

We have some new features and content to implement for our next release. The next build will have our servers in a much more formal production environment using Kubernetes & supporting a larger number of players. We also intend to have our next release available on Android and iOS depending on how our testing goes.

We've setup a lot of core functionality these last few months to support ongoing production of a large scale MMORPG game. Items, stats, rewards, quests, dialogues, buffs, abilities, shops, gathering are all very core foundational features. I'm particularly excited to continue making these much more robust, and then to work on even more exciting features.

Disclaimer: Please note that anything written in this document should not be taken as financial advice. Endless Clouds is dedicated to producing a fun, enjoyable game that integrates NFTs. NFTs are a new and highly experimental technology and should not be bought for investment purposes.
